rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course type {04, 05, 06, 06G, 06PG, 07G, 07PG} owned by {50000567}
For COURSE_CODE IN {3387, L6005} Do Must have passed 72 credit points Otherwise true

description: This unit will examine the main features of WTO law. The topics that will be examined in the unit will include: the WTO in its historical and legal context; the WTO's institutional structure and decision making and negotiating processes; a number of the key WTO agreements in more detail; and the rules governing trade in goods and services in the WTO, in particular the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade 1994 (GATT 1994) and the General Agreement on Trade in Services (GATS), including national treatment, MFN treatment, tariff schedules, market access and key exceptions to the national treatment principle such as public morals, health and environment.
